spans.title: Third and fourth year of Master's degree
spans.paragraph:
Majors:
  • Microprocessors system
  • programming in C/C++/Matlab
  • files and databases
  • operating systems and concurrent programming
  • networks and protocols
With: applied mathematics, probability.
Options:
  • Graphs and algorithms
  • basis of video games
  • compilation techniques
  • networks and systems administration

spans.title: Intern Software Developer
spans.paragraph: Working on a global leader CADCAM software using mostly C++, C# (.NET), Javascript/VBScript

spans.title: Erasmus exchange
spans.paragraph:
Computer science department, majors:
  • Real-time graphics programming
  • advanced software engineering
  • object oriented design using C#

spans.title: End of study project
spans.paragraph: Planning, conceiving and developing an application capable of various interference measures using C# .NET (4.0), MySQL, NUnit. Only software developer on this project.

spans.title: Software Engineer
spans.paragraph: Maintaining a software at SNCF (French railway company), using C# .NET and databases. Working on a new project of an internal website using ASP .NET

spans.title: Edison Engineering Development Program
spans.paragraph:
Two years graduate program in software. Work done during the four six months rotations includes but is not limited to:
  • Contributed to the IIDS (now IIDX) by developing the mapping component in conjunction with the technical leader (two front-end developers).
  • Used the IIDX to develop a proof of concept for the Edison B-course project. The project aimed at allowing the user to create custom dashboards in order to visualize large amount of historical data (electrical equipment data). Single-handedly developed the front-end (JavaScript/CSS/HTML5), project has been very well received and has attracted customer funding already.
  • Working on leading ADMS (see above)

spans.title: Software Engineer
spans.paragraph: Continuity of the last Edison rotation, working on leading ADMS (Advanced Distribution Management System) as part of a two developers/two designers UX team. Large scale project, various development done using C/C++, Oracle SQL but mainly C# (with DevExpress third party) in order to add advanced UI (User Interface) features while considering UX (User Experience).
